latest.title: Admission to Trading
latest.content:
19 Dec 2025 08:09
RNS Number : 2127M
Satsuma Technology PLC
19 December 2025
19 December 2025
Satsuma Technology PLC
('Satsuma' or the 'Company')
Admission to the Equity Shares (Commercial Companies) category
Satsuma Technology PLC (the "Company" or "Satsuma") is pleased to announce that, the Company's ordinary shares of £0.001 each (the "Ordinary Shares") have been admitted to the Equity Shares (Commercial Companies) category of the Official List of the FCA and to trading on the Main Market of the London Stock Exchange.
Admission became effective at 8.00 a.m. (GMT) today, 19 December 2025
Following Admission, the Company's Ordinary Shares remain registered under the existing ISIN GB00BMFCRZ80 and the TIDM remains SATS.
Satsuma Technology PLC
Henry K. Elder, CEO
Data Counsel
Steffan Williams
William Barker
+44 (0)20 3855 8888
satsuma@datacounsel.uk
+44 (0)7767 345 563
+44 (0)7534 068 657

latest.title: Director/PDMR Shareholding
latest.content:
19 Dec 2025 07:00
RNS Number : 2125M
Satsuma Technology PLC
19 December 2025
19 December 2025
Satsuma Technology PLC
('Satsuma' or the 'Company')
Notification and public disclosure of transactions by persons discharging managerial responsibilities ("PDMR")
Satsuma Technology PLC (LSE: SATS) announces that the Company has granted options to each of Henry Elder and Andrew Smith, in accordance with the terms of the Satsuma Technology PLC (Employees) Share Option Plan, to subscribe for 560,195,010 Ordinary Shares and 168,058,503 new Ordinary Shares respectively, vesting equally over 4 years, at an exercise price of (i) £0.01 per Ordinary Share for those options vesting on the first and second anniversary from the date of the grant, and (ii) £0.02 per Ordinary Share for those options vesting on the third and fourth anniversary from the date of the grant.
In addition, further to the conversion of the loan notes as announced on 17 December 2025, the Company has allotted and issued 50,000,000 Ordinary Shares to Henry Elder on 18 December 2025.

company_30s.what_they_do: SATS Ltd is a small, London‑listed micro‑cap that has not yet turned a profit and is currently trading at zero price.
company_30s.why_they_matter: If the company can secure fresh capital or pivot to a high‑growth niche, it could become a low‑cost play for speculative traders.
company_30s.current_state: The firm is pre‑revenue, heavily board‑shuffled, and has no clear product pipeline.

rns_narrative: Corporate housekeeping: a flurry of board appointments, a name change, and a new CEO all within a single week.
Capital‑raising activity: a second convertible loan note closed and several warrants exercised, signalling a push to raise cash.
Strategic shifts: the appointment of a Bitcoin Treasury Strategist and a reported purchase of Bitcoin, hinting at a potential pivot to crypto‑assets.
Financial reporting: interim results for the first quarter of the year were released, but no revenue was disclosed.
Governance updates: a board‑level change of name and a PDMR filing, reflecting ongoing restructuring.

crowd_tape.dominant_theme: The community is silent – no posts or chatter to indicate any consensus.
crowd_tape.bull_narrative: Bulls are largely absent; there is no signal that investors see any upside.
crowd_tape.bear_narrative: Bears are also quiet; the lack of buzz is itself a warning sign that the story is not resonating.
crowd_tape.sentiment_shift: No change – the silence has persisted for weeks, showing no build‑up or decay.

whats_happening_now.attention_check: Google Trends shows zero interest and no momentum. Social volume is nil. The story has been breathing in a vacuum – no external validation and no community support.

near_term_catalysts: Upcoming AGM (if scheduled) could bring a vote on a new strategy or a potential capital raise – a decisive moment for the story.
Possible next RNS could disclose a new funding round or a revenue‑generating partnership, but no concrete dates are available.
expect_next.watch_for: Monitor for any announcement of revenue, a new product launch, or a significant equity placement. Watch also for any director selling activity, which would reinforce a bearish view.
expect_next.timing_regime: Exhausted – the narrative has stalled for months, and the price has collapsed. Entry timing is uncertain and likely to be late if anything moves at all.

buy_vs_sell.bull_case: The company might attract a new investor or pivot to a crypto‑related business, especially given the recent Bitcoin‑related hires. If a fresh capital injection occurs and the firm can generate even a modest revenue stream, the stock could rally from its current zero price.
buy_vs_sell.bear_case: There is no revenue, no product pipeline, zero market interest, and the price is effectively zero. The board changes and Bitcoin purchase are cosmetic at best, and the lack of social buzz signals that investors are not excited. The risk of a complete wipe‑out is high.
buy_vs_sell.risk_reward: Very high risk with limited upside; a 3‑5x return is unlikely unless a major funding event materializes.

playbook.if_bullish: If you decide to take a speculative bet, limit exposure to 1–2% of the portfolio. Enter on a dip if a new funding round is announced, and set a stop‑loss at 5p to protect against further decline.
playbook.if_watching: Hold off until you see either a revenue announcement or a credible equity placement. A clear cash‑in event would justify revisiting the position.
playbook.if_passing: Stay out. The story is flat, the price is zero, and there is no clear path to upside. The risk of loss outweighs any potential gain.

ai_insights.bottom_line: Pass – the story has stalled, there is no market traction, and the risk of loss is high. The only upside would come from a dramatic funding event that is currently speculative at best.

industry_intelligence.name: Industrials
recovery_paths: Order book growth or new contracts

panic_analysis.interpretation: 🟠 Fear dominant - watch for reversal signs
panic_analysis.opportunity_reason: ⚠️ HIGH PANIC + Early timing = Potential accumulation phase

fear_vs_facts.verdict: 🎯 CONTRARIAN OPPORTUNITY - Fear dominates but facts support recovery potential

catalyst_pipeline.title: TR-1: Standard notification of major holdings
Watch for: Funding announcement or operational update

volume_death.description: High volume - Panic spike or interest

technical_score.reason: AI Technical Score 9.0/20 translates to 11/25 points

reasons_to_buy.reason: Early stage positioning offers best R:R if catalysts appear

trader_plan.action: Wait for base + catalyst confirmation; starter position only
trader_plan.risk: Invalidation = breaks recent lows / dilution / suspension
trader_plan.profit_taking: Scale out 25% at +15%, 25% at +50%, runner above

investor_plan.thesis_conditions: Unlock after AI triangulation + CONFIRMED timing

commentary.executive_summary: This report runs in HISTORICAL-ONLY mode: triangulation (RNS/social/trends) not loaded. The setup shows EARLY_BUILD timing with 43/100 APEX score. Historical data shows 0 rallies averaging 0% upside. Current position: +0.0%. Your edge comes from waiting for AI Engine confirmation instead of blind entry.
bull_case: Early regime often offers best risk/reward
commentary.timing_translation: Early accumulation phase. Watch for confirmation before committing size.
commentary.confidence_explained: Confidence 50/100 reflects full data quality with triangulation loaded.

data_quality.disclaimer: Data provided as-is. Not financial advice. AIM micro-caps carry significant volatility risk.
